subject: RE: [junit] Passing Arguments to an ANT Buildfile
msgSnippet: I don t know if this helps or if read the thread correctly, but could he setup a ant property with his default value and if he wants to override it just pass
messageBody:
I don't know if this helps or if read the thread correctly, but could he
setup a ant property with his default value and if he wants to override it
just pass in the new
value on the command line. I use this method to substitute different
properties/config files for the server that I am building. So "ant all"
will build and test on my development box where as "ant all -Dserver=test"
will build and test on my test server. "server" corresponds to a section of
the path where the config files are stored. So to utilize the property I
have the following in my ant script.

<copy todir = "${app.build.home}/WEB-INF">
<fileset dir="${source.home}/WEB-INF/${server}">
<include name = "**/web.xml"/>
</fileset>
</copy>

This really does not require any "if" logic as a value set in the command
line overrides any internally set properties. This technique is explained
in "Ant The Definitive Guide" by Tilly & Burke page 256 Appendix B Ant
Solutions.

I have probably misunderstood and said to much...

Michael

But what he was getting at (for what reason I don't know) was that if he
set it on the commandline as an empty string he wanted to override that
with the default value. The original poster has not yet responded to
any of these responses, but I ask again, why would you ever want that
functionality?

=jason

On Mon, 2003-07-07 at 10:02, Ilja Preuss wrote:
> Timothy Wall wrote:
> > Here's one option, others are probably available using "if" and
> > "condition":
> >
> > <target name="default-value" unless="testfile">
> > <property name="testfile" value="default-value"/>
> > </target>
>
> That's unnecessarily complicated. Simply use
>
> <property name="testfile" value="default-value"/>
>
> Properties can't be overridden, so if it is already set (for example
> from the command line), it still would have the original value.
>
> Regards, Ilja
